name: Cell

childprops.description: The data for this cell from `Grid`s `data` prop.
childprops.name: data

childprops.description: The width of the cell, in pixels.
childprops.name: width

childprops.description: The height of the cell, in pixels.
childprops.name: height

childprops.description: The x index of this cell.
childprops.name: x

childprops.description: The y index of this cell.
childprops.name: y

childprops.description: Is true if the cell is on the top row.
childprops.name: top

childprops.description: Is true if the cell is on the bottom row.
childprops.name: bottom

childprops.description: Is true if the cell is on the left-most column.
childprops.name: left

childprops.description: Is true if the cell is on the right-most column.
childprops.name: right

childprops.description: Is true if the cursor is currently hovering over this cell.
childprops.name: hover

childprops.description: The index of the hit area that is currently being hovered, or `null` if the cursor is not hovering over this cell.
childprops.name: hoverHitArea

description: Cells are created by Grids. They each have a single child, a clone of the component passed to the component prop of Grid. Cells are responsible for x / y positioning, and passing cell-specific props down to your cell components.
comment:
/**
 * @component
 *
 * `Cell`s are created by `Grid`s. They each have a single child, a clone of the component passed to the `component` prop of `Grid`.
 * `Cell`s are responsible for x / y positioning, and passing cell-specific props down to your cell components.
 *
 * @childprop {*} data The data for this cell from `Grid`s `data` prop.
 * @childprop {number} width The width of the cell, in pixels.
 * @childprop {number} height The height of the cell, in pixels.
 * @childprop {number} x The x index of this cell.
 * @childprop {number} y The y index of this cell.
 * @childprop {boolean} top Is true if the cell is on the top row.
 * @childprop {boolean} bottom Is true if the cell is on the bottom row.
 * @childprop {boolean} left Is true if the cell is on the left-most column.
 * @childprop {boolean} right Is true if the cell is on the right-most column.
 * @childprop {boolean} hover Is true if the cursor is currently hovering over this cell.
 * @childprop {number|null} hoverHitArea The index of the hit area that is currently being hovered, or `null` if the cursor is not hovering over this cell.
 */

name: Grid

properties.name: component
properties.description: A React Component to use within each cell in the grid. Note that it must be a React Component, not a React Element.

properties.name: data
properties.description: A 2D array containing data to pass to each cell via their data prop

properties.name: cols
properties.description: Number of colums to render. If not set this will be automatically determined from data.

properties.name: rows
properties.description: Number of rows to render. If not set this will be automatically determined from data.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Sets the pixel size of cells. Pass a number to set width and height at once, or pass an object with x and y values to set width and height separately.

properties.name: allowHover
properties.description: Set allowHover to true to allow computation of hover states on cells and their hit areas, and pass a hover boolean to each cell component.

properties.name: cellHitArea
properties.description: An array of points used to define the shape of the hit area on each cell. Defaults to [[0,0],[1,0],[1,1],[0,1]] which makes the entire surface of each cell is clickable.

properties.name: cellHitAreas
properties.description: An array of arrays of points used to define several hit area shapes on each cell. This prop takes precedence over cellHitArea.

properties.name: className
properties.description: Class names to apply to the Grids DOM element

properties.name: cellClassName
properties.description: Class names to apply to every cell

description:
A grid of cells. This will create a 2D matrix of Cells according to the Grids props. Inside each Cell an element of type props.component is created.

Cell components are positioned in the grid more like sprites than DOM elements, meaning that the size of the contents of cells will have no bearing on the placement of adjacent cells. The cell components themselves can be styled as normal.

name: component
description: {Component} A React Component to use within each cell in the grid. Note that it must be a React Component, not a React Element.
comment: /** {Component} A React Component to use within each cell in the grid. Note that it must be a React `Component`, not a React `Element`. */

description: A 2D array containing data to pass to each cell via their data prop
comment: /** A 2D array containing data to pass to each cell via their `data` prop */

name: cols
description: Number of colums to render. If not set this will be automatically determined from data.
comment: /** Number of colums to render. If not set this will be automatically determined from `data`. */

name: rows
description: Number of rows to render. If not set this will be automatically determined from data.
comment: /** Number of rows to render. If not set this will be automatically determined from `data`. */

description: Sets the pixel size of cells. Pass a number to set width and height at once, or pass an object with x and y values to set width and height separately.
comment: /** Sets the pixel size of cells. Pass a number to set `width` and `height` at once, or pass an object with `x` and `y` values to set `width` and `height` separately. */

name: onCellClick
description: {OnCellClick}
comment: /** {OnCellClick} */

description: Set allowHover to true to allow computation of hover states on cells and their hit areas, and pass a hover boolean to each cell component.
comment: /** Set allowHover to true to allow computation of hover states on cells and their hit areas, and pass a `hover` boolean to each cell component. */

description: An array of points used to define the shape of the hit area on each cell. Defaults to [[0,0],[1,0],[1,1],[0,1]] which makes the entire surface of each cell is clickable.
comment: /** An array of points used to define the shape of the hit area on each cell. Defaults to `[[0,0],[1,0],[1,1],[0,1]]` which makes the entire surface of each cell is clickable. */

name: cellHitAreas
description: An array of arrays of points used to define several hit area shapes on each cell. This prop takes precedence over cellHitArea.
comment: /** An array of arrays of points used to define several hit area shapes on each cell. This prop takes precedence over `cellHitArea`. */

name: className
description: Class names to apply to the Grids DOM element
comment: /** Class names to apply to the `Grid`s DOM element */

description: Class names to apply to every cell
comment: /** Class names to apply to every cell */

params.description: The x coordinate of the clicked cell.
params.name: x

params.description: The y coordinate of the clicked cell.
params.name: y

params.description: The number of the hit area shape that was hit. This will be 0 unless multiple hit areas are defined.
params.name: hitArea

name: OnCellClick
description: A callback that is called when a cell is clicked.
comment:
/**
 * A callback that is called when a cell is clicked.
 *
 * @typedef OnCellClick
 * @param {Number} x The x coordinate of the clicked cell.
 * @param {Number} y The y coordinate of the clicked cell.
 * @param {Number} hitArea The number of the hit area shape that was hit. This will be 0 unless multiple hit areas are defined.
 */
